meanings.definition: Wannest (adjective): most wan or pale in color
meanings.sent1: Her face looked the wannest in the dim light of the evening.
meanings.sent2: The sky turned wannest just before the sun set.
meanings.sent3: The ghost was the wannest of them all, floating eerily in the haunted house.
meanings.sent4: The painting captured the wannest shades of blue, creating a sense of calm.
meanings.sent5: The flower petals were the wannest pink, almost translucent in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Wannest (adverb): in the wanest manner or to the greatest extent of being wan
meanings.sent1: She smiled wannest when she saw her favorite dessert on the table.
meanings.sent2: The stars shone wannest in the darkest night sky.
meanings.sent3: The cat stretched out lazily, purring wannest as it basked in the sun.
meanings.sent4: His voice echoed wannest through the empty hallway, sounding distant and hollow.
meanings.sent5: The wind whispered wannest through the trees, carrying secrets of the forest.
